me.brooks107.stfprocessor

Class Hymn

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.brooks107.stfprocessor.Hymn

  • public class Hymn
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines an entire song or hymn with all verses and choruses etc. This class is also executable, and should be called with either no arguments, or the first hymn number to parse. If no arguments, will start at 0, and always goes up to 840 (inc.).
    Author:
    Simeon Brooks (simeon26@gmail.com)

    • Method Detail

      • getEasyWorshipText

        public java.lang.String getEasyWorshipText()
        Gets the full text of the hymn, in the order of the STF input (although without indents and verse numbers.
        Returns:
        The full text of the hymn as a (String)

      • getEasyWorshipLines

        public java.lang.String[] getEasyWorshipLines()
        Gets all the lines in STF input order. This method cheats and simply takes the output of getEasyWorshipText() and splits the line breaks. Slower but easier
        Returns:
        The lines as a String[]

      • getFirstLine

        public java.lang.String getFirstLine()
        Gets the first line of the hymn (for the title of the hymn)
        Returns:
        The first line as a String

      • getFormat

        public static java.lang.String getFormat(java.util.List<SongBlock> blocks)
        Gets the format string from a list of blocks. Does not support of the compression down into numbers for repeated sections.
        Parameters:
        blocks - The blocks to translate into a format string
        Returns:
        The String

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Executable method. This runs the parser on files with paths matching "./STF/H[Hymn Number].txt", Where [Hymn Number] ranges from the number given from the first argument (or 0 if no args given) up to 840. The outputs are deposited in "./STF output/[Hymn Number with 3 digits] [Hymn first line].txt
        Parameters:
        args - First value can be starting hymn number to parse. Can also be empty, but not null
